WorkItem.Description:
I have performed the Suggested Fix and continue to receive this error. If I am posting this message without having performed the Suggested Fix I am aware that I am consuming the Developer(s) time in managing my Issue unnecessarily.
 
== Version: 4.2.6.0 WPF ==
 
== Error Message ==
There is an error in XML document (45, 10).
Unable to generate a temporary class (result=1).
error CS0016: Could not write to output file 'd:\Documents and Settings\Owner\Local Settings\Temp\nqllpokn.dll' -- 'Access is denied. '
 
 
== StackTrace ==
   at System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Deserialize(XmlReader xmlReader, String encodingStyle, XmlDeserializationEvents events)
   at System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Deserialize(TextReader textReader)
   at Rawr.Character.LoadFromXml(String xml)
 
== These are the Steps that I have tried ==
Installed Rawr, opened Rawr, attempted to import character. Error. Character did not load. There was no suggested fix. It's a fresh install so there's not any more information I can give, and I haven't seen anything else while looking in the Issue Tracker - the import stops at "Parsing Character Data". I've attempted to load different characters and the result comes out the same each time. It's a fresh install.
WorkItem.Summary: Character Import Stuck at Parsing Character Data

Comments.Message: I'm not sure what exactly is happening here, I haven't seen it before. From some googling it seems like one possibility is that your virus scanner is killing the serializer, so I would try temporarily disabling that to see if it helps. Another option would be to try to run Rawr as administrator.
Found the problem, Comodo was sandboxing Rawr without telling me - everything's working fine now.
